20110114150401.000|20110114150403.000|TR0|units, infantry armor, right on the front

20110114150406.000|20110114150408.000|TR0|

20110114150413.000|20110114150416.000|TR0|they think it's time to finally make this

20110114150421.000|20110114150423.000|TR0|policy is that having women serving in 
20110114150423.000|20110114150426.000|TR0|direct combat will hamper mission 
20110114150426.000|20110114150428.000|TR0|effectiveness by hurting unit morale and 
20110114150428.000|20110114150431.000|TR0|cohesion. Comparable arguments were made 
20110114150431.000|20110114150433.000|TR0|with respect to racial integration, but 
20110114150433.000|20110114150436.000|TR0|were ultimately never borne out."
20110114150436.000|20110114150438.000|TR0|

20110114150753.000|20110114150755.000|TR0|

20110114150758.000|20110114150800.000|TR0|would not take no for an answer because I 
20110114150800.000|20110114150803.000|TR0|would give him no over and over again and

20110114150805.000|20110114150808.000|TR0|worked with many of us on these important 
20110114150808.000|20110114150810.000|TR0|issues.  And today I would like to focus

20110114150813.000|20110114150815.000|TR0|everyone's mind as we prepare for the 
20110114150815.000|20110114150818.000|TR0|important arrival of President Hu Jintao, 
20110114150818.000|20110114150820.000|TR0|the future of U.S./China relations.
20110114150820.000|20110114150823.000|TR0|
20110114150823.000|20110114150825.000|TR0|As the state department's youngest ever 
20110114150825.000|20110114150828.000|TR0|assistant secretary of East Asia and 
20110114150828.000|20110114150830.000|TR0|Pacific Affairs, Richard was as Kurt has 
20110114150830.000|20110114150833.000|TR0|said a key player in the brokering of the 
20110114150833.000|20110114150835.000|TR0|opening of formal diplomatic relations 
20110114150835.000|20110114150838.000|TR0|with China in 1979.  Later he served for 
20110114150838.000|20110114150840.000|TR0|many years as the president of the Asia 
20110114150840.000|20110114150842.000|TR0|Society.  Throughout his career, Richard 
20110114150842.000|20110114150845.000|TR0|understood that a strong U.S./China 
20110114150845.000|20110114150847.000|TR0|relationship would bolster stability and 
20110114150847.000|20110114150850.000|TR0|security in the Asia pacific region.
20110114150850.000|20110114150852.000|TR0|
20110114150852.000|20110114150855.000|TR0|And he was also clear eyed about the many 
20110114150855.000|20110114150857.000|TR0|obstacles to our cooperation.  Most of 
20110114150857.000|20110114150900.000|TR0|all, though, he saw that the success of 
20110114150900.000|20110114150902.000|TR0|the relationship depends on its ability to 
20110114150902.000|20110114150905.000|TR0|deliver positive ruts to the people of 
20110114150905.000|20110114150907.000|TR0|both our nation's first and foremost, but 
20110114150907.000|20110114150910.000|TR0|also to the rest of the world.  These 
20110114150910.000|20110114150912.000|TR0|insights remain just as relevant today and 
20110114150912.000|20110114150915.000|TR0|we heard them underscored this week by 
20110114150915.000|20110114150917.000|TR0|Secretary Gates in Beijing and by 
20110114150917.000|20110114150920.000|TR0|Secretaries Geithner and Lock here in 
20110114150920.000|20110114150922.000|TR0|Washington.
20110114150922.000|20110114150925.000|TR0|
20110114150925.000|20110114150927.000|TR0|Three decades after our nation's first 
20110114150927.000|20110114150930.000|TR0|opened the door to engagement, our 
20110114150930.000|20110114150932.000|TR0|relationship is marked by great promise 
20110114150932.000|20110114150935.000|TR0|and real achievements, but also by 
20110114150935.000|20110114150937.000|TR0|significant challenges as one would 
20110114150937.000|20110114150940.000|TR0|expect. And more than ever, we will be 
20110114150940.000|20110114150942.000|TR0|judged on the outcomes that we do produce 
20110114150942.000|20110114150945.000|TR0|for greater peace, prosperity and progress 
20110114150945.000|20110114150947.000|TR0|in our own countries and throughout the 
20110114150947.000|20110114150950.000|TR0|world.
20110114150950.000|20110114150952.000|TR0|
20110114150952.000|20110114150955.000|TR0|America and China have arrived at a 
20110114150955.000|20110114150957.000|TR0|critical juncture, a time when the choices 
20110114150957.000|20110114151000.000|TR0|we make, both big and small, will shape 
20110114151000.000|20110114151002.000|TR0|the trajectory of this relationship.  And 
20110114151002.000|20110114151005.000|TR0|over the past two years in the Obama 
20110114151005.000|20110114151007.000|TR0|administration, we have created the 
20110114151007.000|20110114151010.000|TR0|opportunity for deeper, broader and more 
20110114151010.000|20110114151012.000|TR0|sustained cooperation.  We have seen some 
20110114151012.000|20110114151015.000|TR0|early successes and also some frustrations.
20110114151015.000|20110114151017.000|TR0|
20110114151017.000|20110114151020.000|TR0|And moving forward, it is up to both of us 
20110114151020.000|20110114151022.000|TR0|to more consistently translate positive 
20110114151022.000|20110114151025.000|TR0|words into effective cooperation.  It is 
20110114151025.000|20110114151027.000|TR0|up to both of us to deal with our 
20110114151027.000|20110114151030.000|TR0|differences and there will be always 
20110114151030.000|20110114151032.000|TR0|differences between two great nations.  We 
20110114151032.000|20110114151035.000|TR0|need to deal with them wisely and 
20110114151035.000|20110114151037.000|TR0|responsibly and it is up to both of us to 
20110114151037.000|20110114151040.000|TR0|meet our respective global 
20110114151040.000|20110114151042.000|TR0|responsibilities and obligations.
20110114151042.000|20110114151045.000|TR0|
20110114151045.000|20110114151047.000|TR0|These are the things that will determine 
20110114151047.000|20110114151050.000|TR0|whether our relationship delivers on its 
20110114151050.000|20110114151052.000|TR0|potential in the years to come.  Now, we 
20110114151052.000|20110114151055.000|TR0|have already come a very long way since 
20110114151055.000|20110114151057.000|TR0|the first tentative accepts of the 
20110114151057.000|20110114151100.000|TR0|diplomatic opening in 1979.  After many 
20110114151100.000|20110114151102.000|TR0|years of virtually no contact, we've had 
20110114151102.000|20110114151105.000|TR0|three decades of intense engagement.  In 
20110114151105.000|20110114151107.000|TR0|the beginning, our relationship was almost 
20110114151107.000|20110114151110.000|TR0|exclusively focused on the common threat 
20110114151110.000|20110114151112.000|TR0|posed by the former Soviet Union.
20110114151112.000|20110114151115.000|TR0|
20110114151115.000|20110114151117.000|TR0|And during the 1990s, we began to engage 
20110114151117.000|20110114151120.000|TR0|on broader regional issues.  And I 
20110114151120.000|20110114151122.000|TR0|remember with great fondness the trip that 
20110114151122.000|20110114151125.000|TR0|my husband and I and our daughter took to 
20110114151125.000|20110114151127.000|TR0|china as part of that intense engagement.  
20110114151127.000|20110114151129.000|TR0|Today our relationship has gone global.  
20110114151129.000|20110114151132.000|TR0|We debate and discuss nearly every major 
20110114151132.000|20110114151134.000|TR0|international issue in both bilateral 
20110114151134.000|20110114151137.000|TR0|dialogue and multilateral issues.
20110114151137.000|20110114151139.000|TR0|
20110114151139.000|20110114151142.000|TR0|These are on issues in which we have 
20110114151142.000|20110114151144.000|TR0|concerns together on and also fundamental 
20110114151144.000|20110114151147.000|TR0|disagreements such as human rights.  The 
20110114151147.000|20110114151149.000|TR0|breadth of our engagement will be on full 
20110114151149.000|20110114151152.000|TR0|display next week when President Obama 
20110114151152.000|20110114151154.000|TR0|welcomes the President Hu to the White 
20110114151154.000|20110114151157.000|TR0|House.
20110114151157.000|20110114151159.000|TR0|
20110114151159.000|20110114151202.000|TR0|These three decades of relations between 
20110114151202.000|20110114151204.000|TR0|our countries have also been three decades 
20110114151204.000|20110114151207.000|TR0|of impressive growth for China.  When 
20110114151207.000|20110114151209.000|TR0|Richard Holbrooke and his colleagues first 
20110114151209.000|20110114151212.000|TR0|visited China, its GDP barely topped $100 
20110114151212.000|20110114151214.000|TR0|billion.  Today it is almost $5 trillion.  
20110114151214.000|20110114151217.000|TR0|Trade between our two countries used to be 
20110114151217.000|20110114151219.000|TR0|measured in the hundreds of millions of 
20110114151219.000|20110114151222.000|TR0|dollars.  Today it surpasses $400 billion 
20110114151222.000|20110114151224.000|TR0|annually.
20110114151224.000|20110114151227.000|TR0|
20110114151227.000|20110114151229.000|TR0|China's transformation made possible 
20110114151229.000|20110114151232.000|TR0|primarily by the hard work of its people 
20110114151232.000|20110114151234.000|TR0|and the vision of its leaders was also 
20110114151234.000|20110114151237.000|TR0|aided by an open and dynamic global 
20110114151237.000|20110114151239.000|TR0|economy and by the American power that has 
20110114151239.000|20110114151242.000|TR0|long secured stability in the region.  It 
20110114151242.000|20110114151244.000|TR0|has lifted hundreds of millions out of 
20110114151244.000|20110114151247.000|TR0|grinding poverty and now helps drive 
20110114151247.000|20110114151249.000|TR0|global prosperity.
20110114151249.000|20110114151252.000|TR0|
20110114151252.000|20110114151254.000|TR0|The United States has welcomed will growth 
20110114151254.000|20110114151257.000|TR0|and we have benefited from it.  Today our 
20110114151257.000|20110114151259.000|TR0|economies are entwined and so are our 
20110114151259.000|20110114151302.000|TR0|futures.  But despite its progress in the 
20110114151302.000|20110114151304.000|TR0|past 30 years, China still faces great 
20110114151304.000|20110114151307.000|TR0|challenges.  When I speak with my Chinese 
20110114151307.000|20110114151309.000|TR0|counterparts, they often talk to me in 
20110114151309.000|20110114151312.000|TR0|passionate terms about how far their 
20110114151312.000|20110114151314.000|TR0|country still has to go.
20110114151314.000|20110114151317.000|TR0|
20110114151317.000|20110114151319.000|TR0|Because even with all that growth, China's 
20110114151319.000|20110114151322.000|TR0|GDP is only a third of the size of 
20110114151322.000|20110114151324.000|TR0|America's with nearly four times the 
20110114151324.000|20110114151327.000|TR0|number of people. And our trade with the 
20110114151327.000|20110114151329.000|TR0|European Union is still greater than our 
20110114151329.000|20110114151332.000|TR0|trade with China.  As Secretary Geithner 
20110114151332.000|20110114151334.000|TR0|noted this week, China has a lot of work 
20110114151334.000|20110114151337.000|TR0|to do to move from a state dominated 
20110114151337.000|20110114151339.000|TR0|economy dependent on external demand and 
20110114151339.000|20110114151342.000|TR0|technology to a more market oriented 
20110114151342.000|20110114151344.000|TR0|economy powered by domestic demand and 
20110114151344.000|20110114151347.000|TR0|innovation.
20110114151347.000|20110114151349.000|TR0|
20110114151349.000|20110114151352.000|TR0|More of its people are also seeking 
20110114151352.000|20110114151354.000|TR0|greater respect for their cultural and 
20110114151354.000|20110114151357.000|TR0|religious beliefs.  They're seeking more 
20110114151357.000|20110114151359.000|TR0|opportunity for improved working 
20110114151359.000|20110114151402.000|TR0|conditions and for legal recourse for 
20110114151402.000|20110114151404.000|TR0|injustices. Understanding these strengths 
20110114151404.000|20110114151407.000|TR0|and challenges is essential for us and 
20110114151407.000|20110114151409.000|TR0|others to understand today's China and it 
20110114151409.000|20110114151412.000|TR0|provides important context to the 
20110114151412.000|20110114151414.000|TR0|country's changing role on the world stage 
20110114151414.000|20110114151417.000|TR0|and to the future of the U.S./China 
20110114151417.000|20110114151419.000|TR0|relationship.
20110114151419.000|20110114151421.000|TR0|
20110114151421.000|20110114151424.000|TR0|History teaches that the rise of new 
20110114151424.000|20110114151426.000|TR0|powers often ushers in periods of conflict 
20110114151426.000|20110114151429.000|TR0|and uncertainty.  Indeed on both sides of 
20110114151429.000|20110114151431.000|TR0|the Pacific, we do see some trepidation 
20110114151431.000|20110114151434.000|TR0|about the rise of china and about the 
20110114151434.000|20110114151436.000|TR0|future of the U.S./China relationship.  
20110114151436.000|20110114151439.000|TR0|Some in the region and some here at home 
20110114151439.000|20110114151441.000|TR0|see China's growth as a threat that will 
20110114151441.000|20110114151444.000|TR0|lead either to cold war style conflict or 
20110114151444.000|20110114151446.000|TR0|American decline.
20110114151446.000|20110114151449.000|TR0|
20110114151449.000|20110114151451.000|TR0|And some in China worry that the United 
20110114151451.000|20110114151454.000|TR0|States is bent on containing China's rise 
20110114151454.000|20110114151456.000|TR0|and constraining China's growth, a view 
20110114151456.000|20110114151459.000|TR0|that is stoking a new streak of assertive 
20110114151459.000|20110114151501.000|TR0|Chinese nationalism. We reject those 
20110114151501.000|20110114151504.000|TR0|views.  In the 21st century, it does not 
20110114151504.000|20110114151506.000|TR0|make sense to apply zero sum 19th Century 
20110114151506.000|20110114151509.000|TR0|theories of how major powers interact.  We 
20110114151509.000|20110114151511.000|TR0|are moving through uncharted territory.  
20110114151511.000|20110114151514.000|TR0|We need new ways of understanding the 
20110114151514.000|20110114151516.000|TR0|shifting dynamics of an international land 
20110114151516.000|20110114151519.000|TR0|escape, a landscape marked by emerging 
20110114151519.000|20110114151521.000|TR0|centers of influence, but also by 
20110114151521.000|20110114151524.000|TR0|non-traditional even non-state actors and 
20110114151524.000|20110114151526.000|TR0|the unprecedented challenges and 
20110114151526.000|20110114151529.000|TR0|opportunities created by globalization.
20110114151529.000|20110114151531.000|TR0|
20110114151531.000|20110114151534.000|TR0|This is a pact that we believe is 
20110114151534.000|20110114151536.000|TR0|especially applicable to the U.S./China 
20110114151536.000|20110114151539.000|TR0|relationship.  Our engagement, indeed I 
20110114151539.000|20110114151541.000|TR0|would say our entanglement, can only be 
20110114151541.000|20110114151544.000|TR0|understood in the context of this new and 
20110114151544.000|20110114151546.000|TR0|more complicated landscape.  I said when I 
20110114151546.000|20110114151549.000|TR0|first went to China as secretary of state 
20110114151549.000|20110114151551.000|TR0|early in my tenure that there was an old 
20110114151551.000|20110114151554.000|TR0|Chinese saying that when you're in the 
20110114151554.000|20110114151556.000|TR0|same boat, you have to row in the same 
20110114151556.000|20110114151559.000|TR0|direction.
20110114151559.000|20110114151601.000|TR0|
20110114151601.000|20110114151604.000|TR0|We are in the same boat and we will either 
20110114151604.000|20110114151606.000|TR0|row in the same direction or we will 
20110114151606.000|20110114151609.000|TR0|unfortunately cause turmoil and whirlpools 
20110114151609.000|20110114151611.000|TR0|that will impact not just our two 
20110114151611.000|20110114151614.000|TR0|countries, but many people far beyond 
20110114151614.000|20110114151616.000|TR0|either of our borders.  This is not a 
20110114151616.000|20110114151619.000|TR0|relationship that fits neatly into the 
20110114151619.000|20110114151621.000|TR0|black and white categories like friend or 
20110114151621.000|20110114151624.000|TR0|rival.
20110114151624.000|20110114151626.000|TR0|
20110114151626.000|20110114151629.000|TR0|We are two complex nations with very 
20110114151629.000|20110114151631.000|TR0|different histories, with profoundly 
20110114151631.000|20110114151634.000|TR0|different political systems, and outlooks. 
20110114151634.000|20110114151636.000|TR0| But there is a lot about our people that 
20110114151636.000|20110114151639.000|TR0|reminds us of each other.  An energy, an 
20110114151639.000|20110114151641.000|TR0|entrepreneurial dynamism, a commitment to 
20110114151641.000|20110114151644.000|TR0|a better future for ones children and 
20110114151644.000|20110114151646.000|TR0|grandchildren.  We are both deeply 
20110114151646.000|20110114151649.000|TR0|invested in the current order and we both 
20110114151649.000|20110114151651.000|TR0|have much more to gain from cooperation 
20110114151651.000|20110114151654.000|TR0|than from conflict.
20110114151654.000|20110114151656.000|TR0|
20110114151656.000|20110114151659.000|TR0|Now, that doesn't mean we will not be 
20110114151659.000|20110114151701.000|TR0|competitors.  That's the nature of human 
20110114151701.000|20110114151704.000|TR0|endeavors.  It is who we are as people, 
20110114151704.000|20110114151706.000|TR0|but there are ways of doing it that are 
20110114151706.000|20110114151709.000|TR0|more likely to benefit than not.  A 
20110114151709.000|20110114151711.000|TR0|peaceful and prosperous Asia Pacific 
20110114151711.000|20110114151713.000|TR0|region is in the interests of both China 
20110114151713.000|20110114151716.000|TR0|and the United States.  A thriving America 
20110114151716.000|20110114151718.000|TR0|is good for China and a thriving China is 
20110114151718.000|20110114151721.000|TR0|good for America.
20110114151721.000|20110114151723.000|TR0|
20110114151723.000|20110114151726.000|TR0|Our friends and allies across the Asia 
20110114151726.000|20110114151728.000|TR0|Pacific region would agree.  They also 
20110114151728.000|20110114151731.000|TR0|want to move beyond outdated zero sum 
20110114151731.000|20110114151733.000|TR0|formulas that might force them to choose 
20110114151733.000|20110114151736.000|TR0|between relations with Beijing and 
20110114151736.000|20110114151738.000|TR0|relations with Washington so all of this 
20110114151738.000|20110114151741.000|TR0|calls for careful, steady, dynamic 
20110114151741.000|20110114151743.000|TR0|stewardship of this critical relationship.
20110114151743.000|20110114151746.000|TR0|
20110114151746.000|20110114151748.000|TR0|An approach to China on our part that is 
20110114151748.000|20110114151751.000|TR0|grounded in reality, focused on results 
20110114151751.000|20110114151753.000|TR0|and true to our principles and interests.  
20110114151753.000|20110114151756.000|TR0|And that is how we intend to pursue a 
20110114151756.000|20110114151758.000|TR0|positive, cooperative and comprehensive 
20110114151758.000|20110114151801.000|TR0|relationship with China.  Now, I'm sure 
20110114151801.000|20110114151803.000|TR0|you will hear that phrase quite a bit over 
20110114151803.000|20110114151806.000|TR0|the next week, positive, cooperative, and 
20110114151806.000|20110114151808.000|TR0|comprehensive relationship.
20110114151808.000|20110114151811.000|TR0|
20110114151811.000|20110114151813.000|TR0|Because that really does capture our hopes 
20110114151813.000|20110114151816.000|TR0|for the future and that is how our two 
20110114151816.000|20110114151818.000|TR0|presidents have described this 
20110114151818.000|20110114151821.000|TR0|relationship, but you cannot build a 
20110114151821.000|20110114151823.000|TR0|relationship on aspirations alone.  That 
20110114151823.000|20110114151826.000|TR0|is what makes this a critical juncture.  
20110114151826.000|20110114151828.000|TR0|As I said at the outset, the choices both

20110114151946.000|20110114151948.000|TR0|
20110114151948.000|20110114151951.000|TR0|MIKE CHINOY, U.S./CHINA INSTITUTE:  Well, 
20110114151951.000|20110114151953.000|TR0|it's unquestionably the single most 
20110114151953.000|20110114151956.000|TR0|important bilateral relationship in the 
20110114151956.000|20110114151958.000|TR0|world and is going to really have a 
20110114151958.000|20110114152000.000|TR0|critical impact on the way the whole world 
20110114152000.000|20110114152003.000|TR0|develops in the coming years.  I think the 
20110114152003.000|20110114152005.000|TR0|Obama administration recognizes that.
20110114152005.000|20110114152008.000|TR0|
20110114152008.000|20110114152010.000|TR0|It's interesting in what Secretary Clinton 
20110114152010.000|20110114152013.000|TR0|said, she's really laid out some important 
20110114152013.000|20110114152015.000|TR0|markers in the run up to Chinese President 
20110114152015.000|20110114152018.000|TR0|Hu Jintao's visit to Washington.  She said 
20110114152018.000|20110114152020.000|TR0|that the U.S./China relationship was now 
20110114152020.000|20110114152023.000|TR0|at a critical juncture and it was really 
20110114152023.000|20110114152025.000|TR0|important for both Washington and Beijing 
20110114152025.000|20110114152028.000|TR0|to learn how to manage the relationship in 
20110114152028.000|20110114152030.000|TR0|a mature and intelligent way.
20110114152030.000|20110114152033.000|TR0|
20110114152033.000|20110114152035.000|TR0|She didn't mince any words in indicating 
20110114152035.000|20110114152038.000|TR0|that the two sides did have their 
20110114152038.000|20110114152040.000|TR0|differences.  She noted that the rise of 
20110114152040.000|20110114152043.000|TR0|any new great power can be potentially 
20110114152043.000|20110114152045.000|TR0|very destabilizing.  She explicitly 
20110114152045.000|20110114152048.000|TR0|referred to fears among some in the United 
20110114152048.000|20110114152050.000|TR0|States that the rise of China was a threat 
20110114152050.000|20110114152053.000|TR0|and also to fears on the Chinese side that 
20110114152053.000|20110114152055.000|TR0|somehow the U.S. is trying to contain 
20110114152055.000|20110114152058.000|TR0|China.

20110114152103.000|20110114152105.000|TR0|differently.  She said that's a kind of

20110114152145.000|20110114152148.000|TR0|understanding that will allow them to

20110114152153.000|20110114152155.000|TR0|forward.
20110114152155.000|20110114152158.000|TR0|
20110114152158.000|20110114152200.000|TR0|PHILLIPS:  Well, complicated indeed 
20110114152200.000|20110114152203.000|TR0|because if you look at China and how it's 
20110114152203.000|20110114152205.000|TR0|growing with regard to dominance, just 
20110114152205.000|20110114152208.000|TR0|taking a look at military, economy, 
20110114152208.000|20110114152210.000|TR0|politically.  A lot of critics say, look, 
20110114152210.000|20110114152213.000|TR0|China is the biggest threat and we're not 
20110114152213.000|20110114152215.000|TR0|dealing with that.  You know, the U.S. is 
20110114152215.000|20110114152218.000|TR0|kind of sitting back and sort of letting 
20110114152218.000|20110114152220.000|TR0|things happen whereas we should be more 
20110114152220.000|20110114152223.000|TR0|proactive.  I mean, what's your take on 
20110114152223.000|20110114152225.000|TR0|that?
20110114152225.000|20110114152228.000|TR0|
20110114152228.000|20110114152230.000|TR0|CHINOY:  Well, I think that's a very 
20110114152230.000|20110114152233.000|TR0|oversimplified description. China is 
20110114152233.000|20110114152235.000|TR0|arising power, no question about it.  It's 
20110114152235.000|20110114152238.000|TR0|got the fastest growing economy in the 
20110114152238.000|20110114152240.000|TR0|world.  It came out of crisis in much 
20110114152240.000|20110114152243.000|TR0|better shape than many other countries and 
20110114152243.000|20110114152245.000|TR0|as China becomes richer and more powerful 
20110114152245.000|20110114152248.000|TR0|and more prosperous.  It's understandable 
20110114152248.000|20110114152250.000|TR0|that its leaders and its people feel they 
20110114152250.000|20110114152252.000|TR0|should play what they see as their 
20110114152252.000|20110114152255.000|TR0|rightful role on the international stage 
20110114152255.000|20110114152257.000|TR0|and that includes acquiring the military 
20110114152257.000|20110114152300.000|TR0|muscle to go along with being a great 
20110114152300.000|20110114152302.000|TR0|power.
20110114152302.000|20110114152305.000|TR0|
20110114152305.000|20110114152307.000|TR0|From the U.S. point of view there are 
20110114152307.000|20110114152310.000|TR0|unquestionably things to worry about 
20110114152310.000|20110114152312.000|TR0|because the Chinese and the U.S. have some 
20110114152312.000|20110114152315.000|TR0|serious differences.  China claims 
20110114152315.000|20110114152317.000|TR0|ultimate sovereignty over the island of 
20110114152317.000|20110114152320.000|TR0|Taiwan and the U.S. is committed to 
20110114152320.000|20110114152322.000|TR0|prevent Beijing from using force to 
20110114152322.000|20110114152325.000|TR0|resolve the Taiwan question.  China claims 
20110114152325.000|20110114152327.000|TR0|sovereignty over almost all of the South 
20110114152327.000|20110114152330.000|TR0|China Sea, which borders a half dozen 
20110114152330.000|20110114152332.000|TR0|countries in southeast Asia.
20110114152332.000|20110114152335.000|TR0|
20110114152335.000|20110114152337.000|TR0|The U.S. has said and Secretary Gates 
20110114152337.000|20110114152340.000|TR0|repeated this in a speech in Tokyo that 
20110114152340.000|20110114152342.000|TR0|this is not something the U.S. is prepared 
20110114152342.000|20110114152345.000|TR0|to budge on, that it believes that freedom 
20110114152345.000|20110114152347.000|TR0|of navigation in these water ways is 
20110114152347.000|20110114152350.000|TR0|absolutely essential.  The Chinese are the 
20110114152350.000|20110114152352.000|TR0|closest friends that the North Koreans 
20110114152352.000|20110114152355.000|TR0|have and Washington is very worried about 
20110114152355.000|20110114152357.000|TR0|North Korean behavior.
20110114152357.000|20110114152400.000|TR0|
20110114152400.000|20110114152402.000|TR0|So there are a lot of rough edge edges and 
20110114152402.000|20110114152405.000|TR0|there's a lot of potential for tension, 
20110114152405.000|20110114152407.000|TR0|but I think Secretary Clinton is right 
20110114152407.000|20110114152410.000|TR0|that it's not a black or white situation.  
20110114152410.000|20110114152412.000|TR0|And what you've seen in the last few

20110114152437.000|20110114152440.000|TR0|exchanges, each country and each economy 
20110114152440.000|20110114152442.000|TR0|needs the other.  So you can't say as the

20110114155639.000|20110114155642.000|TR0|to rat out the rat to warn the sleeping 
20110114155642.000|20110114155644.000|TR0|guy. Amazingly, he remained fairly calm.

20110114155701.000|20110114155704.000|TR0|But it's a rare and slow news day when you 
20110114155704.000|20110114155706.000|TR0|can cross a rat story with a tale of a 
20110114155706.000|20110114155709.000|TR0|cross-eyed opossum.
20110114155709.000|20110114155711.000|TR0|
20110114155711.000|20110114155714.000|TR0|Her name is Heidi.  She lives at the 
20110114155714.000|20110114155716.000|TR0|Liestik (ph) zoo in Germany, and her 
20110114155716.000|20110114155719.000|TR0|crossed eyes have seduced opossum lovers 
20110114155719.000|20110114155721.000|TR0|worldwide.  She's got her own Facebook 
20110114155721.000|20110114155724.000|TR0|page with thousands of friends added by 
20110114155724.000|20110114155726.000|TR0|the hour. Making comments like "what big 
20110114155726.000|20110114155729.000|TR0|eyes you have."       A stuffed animal has 
20110114155729.000|20110114155731.000|TR0|been modeled after Heidi.  Kids chant her 
20110114155731.000|20110114155734.000|TR0|name.

20110114155749.000|20110114155751.000|TR0|was originally orphaned in North Carolina

20110114155759.000|20110114155801.000|TR0|so dinky."
